intro: Sakakia hayatae, commonly known as the Japanese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and has lance-shaped leaves. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens. Sakakia hayatae is also known for its ability to thrive in cool climates.
